one_reviews_text: It is a fun little game, though it is clear that it was originally made for the Gear VR and just ported to the Rift. The only way you can interact with the game is by looking around as it does not support a gamepad or Touch. This does make the game feel a little unnatural compared to the rest of the Rift's game library, but at it's heart it is a decent game.

review_title: additctive minigame, imo a bit expensive
one_reviews_text:
This game is pretty good for killing time. Not very complex but it doesn`t take away from the fact that it is a fun game to play with, even if you don't have much time.
Giving only 4stars because I think the app is way too simple for this price (even for a gearVR game).
On the other hand, it costs a price of a box of cigarettes, and this minigame provides fun for lot longer than it would take you to smoke that box of tobacco.

DISCLAIMER- I was given the game for free by the dev.

Its a good use of 360, I'd recommend playing standing up so you can turn around easily or use a spinny chair. The gameplay is very simple and fun.

I'd recommend adding some sort of small prompt at the start so we know how to actually play the game. Also on the menu there is a small halloween looking icon, I can't seem to exit it with the Rift + remote. I wasn't really sure what that was all about!

It's very obviously a Gear VR mobile game port for the rift but if you like retro arcade style games but in 360 and VR then you'll like this :)

review_title: I love cubed Review - XlordB Oculus Rift
one_reviews_text:
Disclaimer - I got this free from the developer. I played up to beating the first boss.

Visuals - nice visuals from the days of nintendo type graphics (imho). 
Gameplay - The concept is great you basically defend a block (princess) inside various points in a sphere from incoming blocks (enemies) and bombs from a boss. You do this my moving your block character by looking around the sphere. If you die you get to upgrade either damage or the princess health. you can continue from where you died.

The performance is fine on my Gtx 970.

So why four stars and not five?
The story is a nice touch its a lot like the days of mario etc.
The gameplay is actually good however moving your head to move the block is a little bit extreme. I say this because you are working from inside a sphere and the boss battle tended to have the boss at the opposite side of the sphere from the princess. This sort of makes it difficult when spinning around (a lot) while your tethered to the rift headset. Touch controls would greatly enhance this aspect of the game.

Optionally It could have more of a 180 degree circle rather than a sphere to save peoples necks.

Apart from this the game is really good and with a bit more development could be the first mario esque (reverse - asteroid) type game to reside on the store.

Final verdict 4/5 mainly due to controls. Easily fixed so well done to bigimmersive. Looking forward to seeing their future titles.

I appreciate the devoleper letting me try this one for free, but compared to other VR Games this can use alot of improvement. it's a cute concept but moving with your head was not that fun, basic design, and somewhat repetive was other flaws
It is a polished little game. You move your guy or girl with your head and try to knock the enemies. There is a simple story and a nice artistic touch. A bit repetittive though.
Like asteroids in reverse with movement via the head. Fun retro feel game. Love it!
